constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 58 (Monday, March 29, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. STAUBER:
H.R. 2290.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, the Necessary and Proper Clause.
Congress shall have power to make all laws which shall be
necessary and proper for carrying into Execution the
foregoing powers and all Powers vested by this Constitution
in the Government of the United States, or in any Department
of Officer thereof.
[Page H1699]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

title: Stop the Shutdowns Act
